docs.snippet: A longtime sports journalist reminisces about the day in 1974 when he first lugged a 15-pound computer he called “the blue monster” to file a story from the road....
docs.lead_paragraph: A longtime sports journalist reminisces about the day in 1974 when he first lugged a 15-pound computer he called “the blue monster” to file a story from the road.
docs.abstract: Sportswriter Gerald Eskenazi recounts experience, in 1974, of attempting to write and submit the first article ever filed in the history of The New York Times via computer; tells tale of dragging bulky machine he called 'the blue monster' to a football training camp on Long Island, where he struggled to feed text back to Manhattan and one of Times's electronic typesetters that would soon revolutionize newspaper production.

headline.main: Filing by Computer: A Pillow Helped
headline.print_headline: Filing by Computer: A Pillow Helped
